ds.util
Class STree<T>

java.lang.Object
  ds.util.STree<T>
All Implemented Interfaces:
Collection<T>, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>
public class STree<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Collection<T>, Iterable<T>, java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable

This class implements the Collection interface using a binary search tree as the underlying storage structure.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Summary
STree()
          Creates an empty binary search tree.

          Adds the specified item to this tree if it is not already present.

          Removes all of the elements from this tree.

          Return a copy of this STree instance.
 boolean contains(java.lang.Object item)
          Returns true if this tree contains the specified element.
 java.lang.String displayTree(int maxCharacters)
          Returns a string that gives a level-order display of this binary search tree; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.
 void drawTree(int maxCharacters)
          Displays this binary search tree in a graphical window and then disposes of the window; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.
 void drawTrees(int maxCharacters)
          Displays this binary binary tree in a graphical window but keeps active the window for a new frame the becomes available after pressing the ENTER key; the argument maxCharacters specifies an upper bound on the string length of the node values.

Constructor Detail

STree

public STree()
Creates an empty binary search tree. All elements inserted into the tree must implement the Comparable interface.

Method Detail

add

public boolean add(T item)
Adds the specified item to this tree if it is not already present.

Specified by:
add in interface Collection<T>
Parameters:
item - element to be added to this tree.
Returns:
true if the tree did not already contain the specified element.

clear

public void clear()
Removes all of the elements from this tree. The resulting tree is empty after the method executes.

Specified by:
clear in interface Collection<T>

toArray

public java.lang.Object[] toArray()
Returns an array containing all of the elements in this tree. The order of elements in the array is the iterator order of elements in the tree.

Specified by:
toArray in interface Collection<T>
Returns:
an array containing all of the elements in this tree.

toString

public java.lang.String toString()
Returns a string representation of this tree. The representation is a comma separated list in iterator order enclosed in square brackets.

Overrides:
toString in class java.lang.Object

find

public T find(T item)
Searches for the specified item in the tree and returns the value of the node that matches item as a key.

Parameters:
item - serves as a key to locate an element in the tree..
Returns:
the value of the node that corresponds to item as a key or null if the element is not found.

public void drawTree(int maxCharacters)

Parameters:

drawTrees

public void drawTrees(int maxCharacters)
